The claim was initially made by Twitter: who stated that the Minnesota Vikings opened U.S. Bank Stadium to shelter the homeless on a cold night in December 2016.
Several news outlets: including Yahoo News and CBS Sports, reported Dellanave's claim as fact, further spreading the information.
The Minnesota Vikings: however, did not open U.S. Bank Stadium on the specified date to shelter the homeless. Dellanave later admitted that he had posted the false information to draw attention to a social issue.
The claim was debunked by Snopes: a reputable fact-checking organization, confirming that the Minnesota Vikings did not provide shelter to the homeless at U.S. Bank Stadium on the mentioned night.
